title: gmail
body: I finally got an invite to <a href="http://gmail.google.com/gmail/">gmail</a>.  It's pretty awesome.  My gmail addy is travis.hardiman&amp;gmail,com (suck it <a href="http://imagezoomer.mozdev.org/stopspam.html">spammers</a>).  Speaking of <a href="http://imagezoomer.mozdev.org/stopspam.html">spam</a>, I'll prolly send out a bulk email to everyone in my address book, updating them of my new email once I get the hang of the whole gmail thing.  Their HTML source is beautifully obfuscated into javascript - they get mad credit for it IMO.  Their code isn't <a href="http://validator.w3.org/check?verbose=1&amp;uri=http%3A//gmail.google.com/gmail/">valid HTML</a> but it works <a href="http://www.brandlogic.com/">seamlessly</a> between browsers so I guess that's ok.  Aside from the initial error I received when I signed up, which was easily fixed by deleting the exiting cookie, I haven't had any problems yet.  I can't wait to fill up my 1GB inbox.
bodyArticleHtml:
2004-06-21

gmail
